code: @Manual{,   title = {mdcBHNU: Brown-headed Nuthatch restoration helper functions},   author = {Tim Lyons},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.01},   url = {https://github.com/tlyons253/mdcBHNU}, }

title: Brown-headed Nuthatch restoration helper functions
text: can install mdcBHNU GitHub : plotting functions work MDC nuthatch project now, others general enough work .motus projects.

title: Brown-headed Nuthatch restoration helper functions
text: might get plot tag hits. may need change path copy .motus file depending mapped computer.
code: library(mdcBHNU)  Sys.setenv(TZ='UTC')  # Always set before opening connections or importing data....UTC avoids issues with time changes due to DST  open_motus('C:/Location/of/motus/database/project-123.motus')->bhnu.con  hit.resident(bhnu.con, project.id=c(123))->bhnu.list  # are mike's towers still active? could add their ID's here if it's just ones local to MO.  close_motus(bhnu.con) # close the connection  bhnu.raw<-bhnu.list[[1]]  hit.cleanup(bhnu.raw)->bhnu.clean  # Simple plot  bhnu.clean%>%   abacus.simple(plot.title="My simple plot",                 x.breaks='5 days',                 DT.limts=c("2025-09-26","2025-12-15"))   # Detailed plot, it uses a list so you can easily play around with how many # individuals to include in any one plot  bhnu.clean%>%   split(.$mfgID)->bhnu.list  bhnu.list[1:10]%>%   abacus.detail(plot.title="First 10 plot",                 x.breaks='3 days',                 DT.limts=c("2025-09-26","2025-12-15"))  bhnu.list[11:20]%>%   abacus.detail(plot.title="Plot 11:20",                 x.breaks='3 days',                 DT.limts=c("2025-09-26","2025-12-15"))

what: A more detailed abacus plot — abacus.detail
title: A more detailed abacus plot — abacus.detail
text: Simple plot symbols different towers overwriting . assumes split data plot subset individuals time. offsets individual tower detections bird slightly, detections multiple towers approximately time discernible.

title: A more detailed abacus plot — abacus.detail
code: abacus.detail(   X,   plot.title = "Tag detections over time",   x.breaks = "7 days",   DT.limits,   x.exp = c(0, 0),   y.exp = c(0, 0) )

title: A more detailed abacus plot — abacus.detail
text: X list "hit" data.frames, element different individual. plot.title Title x.breaks Character string "X days" set tick marks/gridlines. DT.limits min max dates plot, vector character strings x.exp x-axis expand() values making plots pretty y.exp y-axis expand() values making plots pretty

title: A more detailed abacus plot — abacus.detail
text: plot individual tower detections now slightly offset.

what: Stochastic simulation of female-only abundance. Single annual breeding attempt — bhnu.pop.sim
title: Stochastic simulation of female-only abundance. Single annual breeding attempt — bhnu.pop.sim
text: Stochastic simulation female-abundance. Single annual breeding attempt

title: Stochastic simulation of female-only abundance. Single annual breeding attempt — bhnu.pop.sim
code: bhnu.pop.sim(   N.sim,   N.female,   N.years,   ext.thresh = 0,   surv.params,   breed.params,   nest.params,   fledge.params )

title: Stochastic simulation of female-only abundance. Single annual breeding attempt — bhnu.pop.sim
text: N.sim Number simulations N.female Number females initially N.years Number years project ext.thresh (Quasi) extinction threshold abundance surv.params 1 value stochasticity survival; 2 parameters mean/sd breed.params 1 value stochasticity breeding probability; 2 parameters mean/sd nest.params 1 value stochasticity nest survival probability; 2 parameters mean/sd fledge.params 2 parameters simulate number fledglings per successful nest. Generated via binomial first parameter max number fledglings can produced (N), second probability (p_. N*p analogus lambda Poisson distribution.

title: Stochastic simulation of female-only abundance. Single annual breeding attempt — bhnu.pop.sim
text: Two element list projection matrix Nsim x N.years, probability extinction.

what: Filters for Motus hits, or any table of time-stamped telemetry data with similarly named fields — hit.cleanup
title: Filters for Motus hits, or any table of time-stamped telemetry data with similarly named fields — hit.cleanup
text: Likely duplicates many internal fiters motusFilter field, gives control. remove fields related frequency, signal, noise, burst interval pulse length prior function.

title: Filters for Motus hits, or any table of time-stamped telemetry data with similarly named fields — hit.cleanup
code: hit.cleanup(   X,   freqsd.limit = 0.1,   SNR.limit = 10,   pulse.limit = c(2.3, 2.7),   burst.limit = c(19.5, 20.3),   min.run = 2,   max.run = 500 )

title: Filters for Motus hits, or any table of time-stamped telemetry data with similarly named fields — hit.cleanup
text: X data.frame "hits" like "alltags". freqsd.limit max sd frequency read hit. highly variable frequencies detected likely mean false detection SNR.limit signal noise ratio threshold. Values considered detection. Engineers generally consider SNR 10 minimum say signal detected pulse.limit vector minimum maximum pulse length consider. Pulse lengths outside tag design likely indicate false detections. burst.limit vector min max burst interval. Values far expected burst interval may indicate interference false signals min.run minimum run length max.run maximum run length. Used filter tags may dropped, recovered.

title: Filters for Motus hits, or any table of time-stamped telemetry data with similarly named fields — hit.cleanup
text: data frame similar input, filters added

what: Extract hits for resident birds — hits.resident
title: Extract hits for resident birds — hits.resident
text: Extract hits resident birds

title: Extract hits for resident birds — hits.resident
Extract hits for resident birds — hits.resident
text: connect database connection returned read.motus project.id numeric vector, c(), specifying project ID(s) towers wish include detection. resident birds, filters likely spurious detections. omitted, hits considered valid

title: Extract hits for resident birds — hits.resident
text: list 3 elements, first data.frame "alltags", second   "recvDeps" table, third "tagDeps" table , .motus   recorded deploy date tag year releseas "cohort"   field. alltags table automatically filtered include detections   towers associated particular project, towers   deployed within resident bird study. future version take   sf::st_bbox() object use detections tower within bounding   box

title: Extract hits for resident birds — hits.resident
code: read.motus('C:/.../proj.motus')->motus.con #> Error in read.motus("C:/.../proj.motus"): could not find function "read.motus"   hit.resident(motus.con, c(123))->tmp.list #> Error in hit.resident(motus.con, c(123)): could not find function "hit.resident"  # hits only on towers associated with project 123   hit.resident(motus.con)->tmp.list2 #> Error in hit.resident(motus.con): could not find function "hit.resident"  # hits from any tower   my.hits<-tmp.list[[1]] #get the hits table #> Error: object 'tmp.list' not found

title: mdcBHNU 0.0.01
mdcBHNU 0.0.01
text: Added pop sim function estimate (quasi) extinction risk nuthatches using stochastic simulation (ala RAMAS). Assumes single breeding attempt per year.

title: mdcBHNU 0.0.01
text: added data, filter, plot functions
